paper_abstract: Many communication algorithms in parallel systems can be efficiently solved by obtaining edge disjoint Hamiltonian cycles in the interconnection topology of the network The Eisenstein-Jacobi (EJ) network generated by alpha = a + b rho, where rho = (1 + i root 3)/2, is a degree six symmetric interconnection network The hexagonal network is a special case of the EJ network that can be obtained by alpha = a + (a+1) rho. Generating three edge disjoint Hamiltonian cycles in the EJ network with generator alpha = a + b rho for gcd (a, b) = 1 has been shown before. However, this problem has not been solved when gcd(a, b) = d > 1. In this paper, some results to this problem are given. (C) 2015 Elsevier Inc. All rights reserved.
paper_title: Edge disjoint Hamiltonian cycles in Eisenstein-Jacobi networks
